snippet: The view that Medicare recipients get only what they have paid for through taxes, premiums and medical co-payments has challenged lawmakers as they try to limit spending.
abstract: View that Medicare and Social Security recipients get only what they have paid for through taxes, premiums and medical co-payments is challenging lawmakers as they try to limit spending; average single male who retired at age 65 in 2010 will receive over $100,000 more in benefits than he paid in taxes, gap is projected to grow; current retirees are roughly breaking even when it comes to Social Security, but future retirees are projected to pay in more than they take out.
lead_paragraph: The view that Medicare recipients get only what they have paid for through taxes, premiums and medical co-payments has challenged lawmakers as they try to limit spending.

headline.seo: Misperception of Government Benefits Makes Trimming Them Harder
